subject: Mental Health
title: Weight Stigma and Health
description: One-minute skill: Weight Stigma and Health.

hook.text: Doctors spend less time with larger patients and order fewer tests. Bias kills.

buildup.text: Weight stigma is discrimination based on body size â€” and it's the last acceptable prejudice.

discovery.text: Studies show weight stigma increases cortisol, inflammation, and avoidance of healthcare.

twist.text: The stress of stigma causes more health damage than the weight itself in many cases.

climax.text: Weight-neutral healthcare improves outcomes by focusing on behaviors, not the scale.

punchline.text: Shaming people thinner has never worked. Science confirms it.

quiz.question: What does research show about weight stigma and health?
options: Stigma stress causes significant health damage independent of weight
